sen.j: ここでは日本料理の中にある和食の一分野である会席料理を紹介する。
sen.e: This page describes Kaiseki Ryori, a Japanese full course meal in Japanese cuisine.
This page describes kaiseki ryori, a full course meal form of Japanese cuisine.

sen.j: 会席料理（かいせきりょうり）は、和食の料理形式の一である。
sen.e: Kaiseki ryori is a form of Japanese cuisine.

sen.j: 会席料理は宴席に供される料理である。
sen.e: Kaiseki ryori is served at a feast.

sen.j: 本膳料理が廃れた現在、日本料理に於いては、儀式などで出される最も正統な料理形式である。
sen.e: Currently, it is one of the most authentic Japanese meals served at ceremonies, etc after 'honzen ryori' (a ritualistic meal served on 'honzen' or a legged tray) is obsolete.
In modern times it has become the most authentic style of Japanese meal to serve at ceremonies, as 'honzen ryori' (a ritual meal served on a 'honzen' or legged tray) has fallen out of general use.

sen.j: 会席とはもともと連歌や俳諧の席のこと。
sen.e: The term, "kaiseki" (会席) originally referred to a poetic gathering, especially of renga (linked verse) and haikai (17-syllable verse).

sen.e: The basic menu of kaiseki ryori consists of three dishes with soup (Japanese broth, sashimi or slices of raw fish, grilled and boiled foods).
